March 27, 2007; retrieved 2011-10-19. ==Events of Kaika's life== The absence of information about Kaika does not imply that no such person ever existed. Very little information is available for study prior to the reign of the 29th monarch, Emperor Kimmei.Titsingh, pp. 34-36; Brown, pp. 261-262; Varley, pp. 123-124. === After his death === This emperor's official name after his death (his posthumous name) was regularized many centuries after the lifetime which was ascribed to Kaika. The actual site of his grave is not known. According to the Imperial Household Agency, this emperor is venerated at a memorial Shinto shrine (misasagi) in Nara. ==Related pages== * Emperor of Japan * List of emperors of Japan * Japanese imperial family tree == References == == Other websites== Category:Emperors of Japan
